Hadith-181.Translation: O Allah, surely [name the person] is under Your protection, and in the rope of Your security, so save him from the trial of the grave and from the punishment of the Fire. You fulfill promises and grant rights, so forgive him and have mercy on him. Surely You are Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Hadith-181.Title: Prayer for deceased person at the funeral
Hadith-181.Text: اللَّهُمَّ عَبْدُكَ وَابْنُ أَمَتِكَ احْتَاجَ إِلَى رَحْمَتِكَ وَأَنْتَ غَنِيٌّ عَنْ عَذَابِهِ إِنْ كَانَ مُحْسِنًا فَزِدْ فِي حَسَنَاتِهِ وَإِنْ كَانَ مُسِيئًا فَتَجَاوَزْ عَنْهُ
Hadith-181.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'abduka wabnu 'amatika ihtaaja 'ilaa rahmatika, wa 'Anta ghaniyyun 'an 'athaabihi, 'in kaana muhsinan fazid fee hasanaatihi, wa 'in kaana musee'an fatajaawaz 'anhu.
Hadith-181.Translation: O Allah, Your male slave and the child of Your female slave is in need of Your mercy, and You are not in need of his torment. If he was pious then increase his rewards and if he was a transgressor then pardon him.

Hadith-75.Title: Prayer for the person who offered to drink or intended to
Hadith-75.Text: اللَّهُمَّ أَطْعِمْ مَنْ أَطْعَمَنِي وَاسْقِ مَنْ سَقَاني
Hadith-75.Translation: O Allah, feed the one who has fed me and drink to the one who has given me drink.

Hadith-210.Title: Prayer of assistance in payment of debt
Hadith-210.Text: اللَّهُمَّ اكْفِنِي بِحَلاَلِكَ عَنْ حَرَامِكَ وَأَغْنِنِي بِفَضْلِكَ عَمَّنْ سِوَاكَ
Hadith-210.Transliteration: Allaahummak-finee bihalaalika 'an haraamika wa 'aghninee bifadhlika 'amman siwaaka.
Hadith-210.Translation: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden, and make me independent of all others besides You.

Hadith-210.Title: Prayer of assistance in payment of debt
Hadith-210.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ وَضَلَع ا يَّلدْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
Hadith-210.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oothu bika minal-hammi walhazani, wal'ajzi walkasali, walbukhli waljubni, wa dhala'id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rijaali.
Hadith-210.Translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and from being overpowered by men.

Hadith-29.Title: Prayer of the debtor for the lender when debt is returned
Hadith-29.Text: بارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ فِي أَهْلِكَ وَمَالِكَ إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ السَّلَفِ الْحَمْدُ وَالْأَدَاءُ
Hadith-29.Transliteration: Baarakallaahu laka fee 'ahlika wa maalika, 'innamaa jazaa'us-salafil-hamdu wal'adaa'.
Hadith-29.Translation: May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth, surely the reward for a loan is praise and returning (what was borrowed).

Hadith-19.Title: Prayer of the guest for the host who treated him
Hadith-19.Text: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَهُمْ فِيمَا رَزَقْتَهُمْ وَاغْفِرْ لَهُمْ وَارْحَمْهُمْ
Hadith-19.Transliteration: Allaahumma baarik lahum feemaa razaqtahum, waghfir lahum warhamhum.
Hadith-19.Translation: O Allah, bless them in what You have provided for them, and forgive them and have mercy on them.

Hadith-130.Title: Prayer of the traveller before dawn
Hadith-130.Text: سَمَّعَ سَامِعٌ بِحَمْدِ اللهِ وَحُسْنِ بَلاَئِهِ عَلَيْنَا رَبَّنَا صَاحِبْنَا وَأَفْضِلْ عَلَيْنَا عَائِذًا بِاللهِ مِنَ النَّارِ
Hadith-130.Transliteration: Sami'a saami'un bihamdillaahi wa husni balaa'ihi 'alaynaa. Rabbanaa saahibnaa, wa 'afdhil 'alaynaa 'aa'ithan billaahi minan-naar.
Hadith-130.Translation: He Who listens has heard that we praise Allah for the good things He gives us. Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us. I seek the protection of Allah from the Fire.

Hadith-233.Title: Prayers upon the Prophet (saws) after the tashahhud
Hadith-233.Text: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ كَاَم صَلَّيْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيدٌ اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ كَاَم بَارَكْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيدٌ
Hadith-233.Transliteration: Allaahumma salli 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa sallayta'alaa 'Ibraheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed. Allahumma baarik 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa baarakta 'alaa 'Ibraheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed.
Hadith-233.Translation: O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad and on the family of Muhammad as You have bestowed Your favor on Ibrahim and on the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious. O Allah, bless Muhammad and the Family of Muhammad as You have blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious.

Hadith-233.Title: Prayers upon the Prophet (saws) after the tashahhud
Hadith-233.Text: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَى أَزْوَاجِهِ وَذُرِّيَّتِهِ كَاَم صَلَّيْتَ عَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَبَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَى أَزْواجِهِ وَذُرِّيَّتِهِ كَاَم بَارَكْتَ عَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيدٌ
Hadith-233.Transliteration: Allahumma salli 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'azwaajihi wa thurriyyatihi, kamaa sallayta 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraheema. Wa baarik 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'azwajihi wa thurriyyatihi, kamaa baarakta 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraheema. 'Innaka Hameedun Majeed.
Hadith-233.Translation: O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad and upon his wives and progeny as You have bestowed Your favor upon the family of Ibrahim. And bless Muhammad and his wives and progeny as You have blessed the family of Ibrahim, You are full of praise, Most Glorious.

Hadith-184.Title: Qunoot Al-Witr
Hadith-184.Text: اللَّهُمَّ اهْدِنِي فِيمَنْ هَدَيْتَ، وَعَافِنِي فِيمَنْ عَافَيْتَ، وَتَوَلَّنِي فِيمَنْ تَوَلَّيْتَ، وَبَارِكْ لِي فِيمَا أَعطَيْتَ، وَقِنِي شَرَّ مَا قَضَيْتَ، فَإِنَّكَ تَقْضِي وَلَا يُقْضَى عَلَيْكَ، إِنَّهُ لَا يَذِلُّ مَنْ وَالَيْتَ، [وَلَا يَعِزُّ مَنْ عَادَيْتَ]، تَبَارَكْتَ رَبَّنَا وَتَعَالَيْتَ
Hadith-184.Transliteration: Allaahum-mahdinee feeman hadayta, wa 'aafinee feeman 'aafayta, wa tawallanee feeman tawallayta, wa baarik lee feemaa 'a'atayta, wa qinee sharra maa qadhayta, fa'innaka taqdhee wa laa yuqdhaa 'alayka, 'innahu laa yathillu man waalayta, [wa laa ya 'izzu man 'aadayta], tabaarakta Rabbanaa wa ta'aalayta.
Hadith-184.Translation: O Allah, guide me with those whom You have guided, and strengthen me with those whom You have given strength. Take me to Your care with those whom You have taken to Your care. Bless me in what You have given me. Protect me from the evil You have ordained. Surely, You command and are not commanded, and none whom You have committed to Your care shall be humiliated [and none whom You have taken as an enemy shall taste glory]. You are Blessed, Our Lord, and Exalted.

Hadith-184.Title: Qunoot Al-Witr
Hadith-184.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِرِضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ، وَبِمُعَافَاتِكَ مِنْ عُقُوبَتِكَ، وأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْكَ، لَا أُحْصِي ثَنَاءً عَلَيْكَ، أَنْتَ كَمَا أَثْنَيْتَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ
Hadith-184.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oothu biridhaaka min sakhatika, wa bimu'aafaatika min 'uqoobatika, wa 'a'oothu bika minka, laa 'uhsee thanaa'an 'alayka, 'Anta kamaa 'athnayta 'alaa nafsika.
Hadith-184.Translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with Your Pleasure from Your anger. I seek refuge in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek refuge in You from You. I cannot count Your praises, You are as You have praised Yourself.

Hadith-184.Title: Qunoot Al-Witr
Hadith-184.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ، وَلَكَ نُصَلِّي وَنَسْجُدُ، وَإِلَيْكَ نَسْعَى وَنَحْفِدُ، نَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ، وَنَخْشَى عَذَابَكَ، إِنَّ عَذَابَكَ بِالْكَافِرِينَ مُلْحَقٌ. اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْتَعِينُكَ، وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ، وَنُثْنِي عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ، وَلَا نَكْفُرُكَ، وَنُؤْمِنُ بِكَ وَنَخْضَعُ لَكَ، وَنَخْلَعُ مَنْ يَكْفُرُكَ
Hadith-184.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'iyyaaka na'budu, wa laka nusallee wa nasjudu, wa 'ilayka nas'aa wa nahfidu, narjoo rahmataka, wa nakhshaa 'athaabaka, 'inna 'athaabaka bilkaafireena mulhaq. Allaahumma 'innaa nasta'eenuka, wa nastaghfiruka, wa nuthnee 'alaykal-khayr, wa laa nakfuruka, wa nu'minu bika, wa nakhdha'u laka, wa nakhla'u man yakfuruka.
Hadith-184.Translation: O Allah, You alone do we worship and to You we pray and bow down prostrate. To You we hasten to worship and to serve. Our hope is for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. Surely, Your punishment of the disbelievers is at hand. O Allah, we seek Your help and Your forgiveness, and we praise You beneficently. We do not deny You and we believe in You. We surrender to You and renounce whoever disbelieves in You.

Hadith-79.Title: Remembrance after salam
Hadith-79.Text: أسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ أسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ أسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلاَمُ وَمِنْكَ السَّلاَمُ تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
Hadith-79.Transliteration: 'Astaghfirullaaha, 'Astaghfirullaaha, 'Astaghfirullaaha. Allaahumma 'Antas-Salaamu wa minkas-salaamu, tabaarakta yaa Thal-Jalaali wal-'Ikraam.
Hadith-79.Translation: I seek the forgiveness of Allah (three times). O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Owner of majesty and honor.

Hadith-79.Title: Remembrance after salam
Hadith-79.Text: لَا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، اللَّهُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلَا مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
Hadith-79.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer, Allaahumma laa maard'a limaa 'a'tayta, wa laa mu'tiya limaa mana'ta, wa laa yanfa'u thal-jaddi minkal-jadd.
Hadith-79.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld; and the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You

Hadith-79.Title: Remembrance after salam
Hadith-79.Text: "لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللهِ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللهُ، وَلَا نَعْبُدُ إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ، لَه النِّعْمَةُ وَلَهُ الْفَضْلُ وَلَهُ الثَّنَاءُ الْحَسَنُ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللهُ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الْكَافِرُونَ"
Hadith-79.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku, wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay 'in Qadeer. Laa hawla wa laa quwwata 'illaa billaahi, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu, wa laa na'budu 'illaa 'iyyaahu, lahun-ni'matu wa lahul-fadhlu wa lahuth-thanaa'ul-hasanu, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu mukhliseena lahud-deena wa law karihal-kaafiroon.
Hadith-79.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things. There is no power and no might except by Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and we do not worship any other besides Him. His is grace, and His is bounty and to Him belongs the most excellent praise. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah. (We are) sincere in making our religious devotion to Him, even though the disbelievers may dislike it.

Hadith-79.Title: Remembrance after salam
Hadith-79.Text: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ (33) الْحَمْدُ للهِ (33) وَاللهُ أَكْبَرُ (33)  لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
Hadith-79.Transliteration: Subhaanallaahi, walhamdu lillaahi wallaahu 'Akbar - (33 times). Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamduwaHuwa'alaakullishay'in Qadeer.
Hadith-79.Translation: Glory is to Allah, and praise is to Allah, and Allah is the Most Great (each said thirty-three times). None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.

Hadith-79.Title: Remembrance after salam
Hadith-79.Text: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ  يُحيي و يُميتُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
Hadith-79.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu yuhyee wa yumeetu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
Hadith-79.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death, and He is Able to do all things.

Hadith-79.Title: Remembrance after salam
Hadith-79.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نافِعًا وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلَّا
Hadith-79.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka 'ilman naafi'an, wa rizqan tayyiban, wa 'amalan mutaqabbalan.
Hadith-79.Translation: O Allah, I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit, a good provision, and deeds that will be accepted.

Hadith-177.Title: Remembrance at Muzdalifa
Hadith-177.Text: أَللهُ أَكْبَرُ. لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ. لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ
Hadith-177.Translation: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) rode his camel, Al-Qaswa', until he reached the sacred area (Al-Mash'aril-Haraam). Then he faced the Qiblah and invoked Allah, and repeatedly said the words:Allah is the Most Great, Allah is One and There is none worthy of worship but Allah. He remained stationary until the sky became yellow with the dawn, and then pressed on before sunrise.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ وَحْدَهُ وَالصَّلاَةُ وَالسَّلاَمُ عَلَى مَنْ لاَ نَبَّي بَعْدَهُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Aalhamdu lillahi wahdahu wassalaawatu wassalamu 'aalyaman laannabiyuu ba'dahu
Hadith-164.Translation: All praise is due to Allah alone, and peace and blessings be upon him after whom there is no other Prophet.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text:
أَعُوذُ بالله مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
اللَّـهُ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَّهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ مَن ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلَّا بِمَا شَاءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَئُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: 'A 'oothu billaahi minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem. Allaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwal-Hayyul-Qayyoom, laa ta'khuthuhu sinatun wa laa nawm, lahu maa fis-samaawaati wa maa fil-'ardh, man thai-lathee yashfa'u 'indahu 'illaa bi'ithnih, ya'lamu maa bayna 'aydeehim wa maa khalfahum, wa laa yuheetoona bishay'im-min 'ilmihi 'illaa bimaa shaa'a, wasi'a kursiyyuhus samaawaati wal'ardh, wa laa ya'ooduhu hifdhuhumaa, wa Huwal- 'Aliyyul- 'Adheem.
Hadith-164.Translation: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast. - Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission? He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter. And they will never encompass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills. His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth, and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ للهِ وَالْحَمْدُ للهِ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ رَبِّ أسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِي هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَخَيرَ مَا بَعْدَهُ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِي هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِي النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِي الْقَبْرِ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: 'Asbahnaa wa 'asbahal-mulku lillaahi walhamdu lillaahi, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer. Rabbi 'as'aluka khayra maa fee haathal-yawmi wa khayra maa ba'dahu wa 'a'oothu bika min sharri maa fee haathal-yawmi wa sharri maa ba'dahu, Rabbi 'a'oothu bika minal-kasali, wa soo'il-kibari, Rabbi 'a'oothu bika min 'athaabin fin-naari wa 'athaabin fil-qabri.
Hadith-164.Translation: We have entered a new day and with it all dominion is Allah's. Praise is to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. To Allah belongs the dominion, and to Him is the praise and He is Able to do all things. My Lord, I ask You for the goodness of this day and of the days that come after it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this day and of the days that come after it. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and helpless old age. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell-fire, and from the punishment of the grave.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: أمْسَيْنَا وَأمْسَى الْمُلْكُ للهِ وَالْحَمْدُ للهِ  لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ رَبِّ أسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِي هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَخَيرَ مَا بَعْدَهَا وَأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِي هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا رَبِّ أعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ رَبِّ أعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِي النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِي الْقَبْرِ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: 'Amsaynaa wa'amsal-mulku lillaah walhamdu lillaahi, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer. Rabbi 'as'aluka khayra maa fee haathal-laylati, wa khayra maa ba'dahu wa 'a'oothu bika min sharri maa fee haathal-laylati, wa sharri maa ba'dahaa, Rabbi 'a'oothu bika minal-kasali, wa soo'il-kibari, Rabbi 'a'oothu bika min 'athaabin fin-naari wa 'athaabin fil-qabri.
Hadith-164.Translation: We have ended another day and with it all dominion is Allah's. Praise is to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. To Allah belongs the dominion, and to Him is the praise and He is Able to do all things. My Lord, I ask You for the goodness of this day and of the days that come after it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this day and of the days that come after it. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and helpless old age. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell-fire, and from the punishment of the grave.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا وَبِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا وَبِكَ نَحْيَا وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُورُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma bika 'asbahnaa, wa bika 'amsaynaa, wa bika nahyaa, wa bika namootu wa 'ilaykan-nushoor.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, by You we enter the morning and by You we enter the evening,  by You we live and and by You we die, and to You is the Final Return.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا وَبِكَ نَحْيَا وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma bika 'amsaynaa wa bika 'asbahnaa, wa bika nahyaa, wa bika namoot, wa 'ilaykal-maseer.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, You bring us the end of the day as You bring us its beginning, You bring us life and you bring us death, and to You is our fate.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: للَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَأَنَا عَلَى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَي وَأَبُوءُ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'Anta Rabbee laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, khalaqtanee wa 'anaa 'abduka, wa 'anaa 'alaa 'ahdika wa wa'dika mas-tata'tu, 'a'oothu bika min sharri maa sana'tu, 'aboo'u laka bini'matika 'alayya, wa 'aboo'u bithanbee faghfir lee fa'innahu laa yaghfiruth-thunooba 'illaa 'Anta.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is none worthy of worship but You. You created me and I am your slave. I keep Your covenant, and my pledge to You so far as I am able. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I admit to Your blessings upon me, and I admit to my misdeeds. Forgive me, for there is none who may forgive sins but You.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَصْبَحْتُ  أُشْهِدُكَ وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ وَمَلاَئِكَتَكَ وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللهُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'asbahtu 'ush-hiduka wa 'ush-hidu hamalata 'arshika, wa malaa'ikataka wajamee'a khalqika, 'annaka 'Antallaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta wahdaka laa shareeka laka, wa 'anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa Rasooluka.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, I have entered a new morning and call upon You and upon the bearers of Your Throne, upon Your angels and all creation to bear witness that surely You are Allah, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partners, and that Muhammad is Your slave and Your Messenger.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَمْسَيْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ وَمَلاَئِكَتَكَ وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللهُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'amsaytu 'ush-hiduka wa 'ush-hidu hamalata 'arshika, wa malaa'ikataka wajamee'a khalqika, 'annaka 'Antallaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta wahdaka laa shareeka laka, wa 'anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa Rasooluka.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, I have ended another day and call upon You and upon the bearers of Your Throne, upon Your angels and all creation to bear witness that surely You are Allah, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partners, and that Muhammad is Your slave and Your Messenger.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ مَا أَصْبَحَ بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma maa 'asbaha bee min ni'matin 'aw bi'ahadin min khalqika faminka wahdaka laa shareeka laka, falakal-hamdu wa lakash-shukru.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, whatever blessing has been received by me or anyone of Your creation is from You alone, You have no partner. All praise is for you and thanks is to You.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ مَا أَمْسَى بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma maa 'amsaa bee min ni'matin 'aw bi'ahadin min khalqika faminka wahdaka laa shareeka laka, falakal-hamdu wa lakash-shukru.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, as I enter this evening is from You alone, You have no partner. All praise is for you and thanks is to You.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَدَنِي اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي سَمْعِي اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَصَرِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ اللَّهُمّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُفْرِ وَالفَقْرِ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'aafinee fee badanee, Allaahumma 'aafinee fee sam'ee, Allaahumma 'aafinee fee basaree, laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta (three times). Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oothu bika minal-kufri, walfaqri, wa 'a'oothu bika min 'athaabil-qabri, laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta. (three times)
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, make me healthy in my body. O Allah, preserve for me my hearing. O Allah, preserve for me my sight. There is none worthy of worship but You. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from disbelief and poverty and I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave. There is none worthy of worship but You.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: حَسْبِيَ اللهُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Hasbiyallaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwa 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa Huwa Rabbul-'Arshil-'Adheem.
Hadith-164.Translation: Allah is sufficient for me. There is none worthy of worship but Him. I have placed my trust in Him, He is Lord of the Majestic Throne.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: للَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي دِينِي وَدُنْيَايَ وَأَهْلِي وَمَالِي اللَّهُمَّ اسْتُرْ عَوْرَاتِي وَآمِنْ رَوْعَاتِي اللَّهُمَّ احْفَظْنِي مِنْ بَينِ يَدَيَّ وَمِنْ خَلْفِي وَعَنْ يَمِينِي وَعَنْ شِمَالِي وَمِنْ فَوْقِي وَأَعُوذُ بِعَظَمَتِكَ أَنْ أُغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِي
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'afwa wal'aafiyata fid-dunyaa wal'aakhirati, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'afwa wal'aafiyata fee deenee wa dunyaaya wa 'ahlee, wa maalee, Allaahum-mastur 'awraatee, wa 'aamin raw'aatee, Allaahum-mahfadhnee min bayni yadayya, wa min khalfee, wa 'an yameenee, wa 'an shimaalee, wa min fawqee, wa 'a'oothu bi'adhamatika 'an 'ughtaala min tahtee.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in this world and the next. O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness and Your protection in my religion, in my worldly affairs, in my family and in my wealth. O Allah, conceal my secrets and preserve me from anguish. O Allah, guard me from what is in front of me and behind me, from my left, and from my right, and from above me. I seek refuge in Your Greatness from being struck down from beneath me.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ عَالِمَ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَاطِرَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ رَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَمَلِيكَهُ أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِي وَمِنْ شَرِّ الشَيْطَانِ وَشِرْكِهِ وَأَنْ أَقْتَرِفَ عَلَى نَفْسِي سُوءًا أَوْ أَجُرَّهُ إِلَى مُسْلِمٍ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'Aalimal-ghaybi wash-shahaadati faatiras-samaawaati wal'ardhi, Rabba kulli shay'in wa maleekahu, 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, 'a'oothu bika min sharri nafsee, wa min sharrish-shaytaani wa shirkihi, wa 'an 'aqtarifa 'alaa nafsee soo'an, 'aw 'ajurrahu 'ilaa Muslimin.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the evident, Maker of the heavens and the earth, Lord of everything and its Possessor, I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil of Satan and his helpers. (I seek refuge in You) from bringing evil upon my soul and from harming any Muslim.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ الَّذِي لاَ يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلاَ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Bismillaahil-lathee laa yadhurru ma'as-mihi shay'un fil-'ardhi wa laa fis-samaa'i wa Huwas-Samee 'ul- 'Aleem.
Hadith-164.Translation: In the Name of Allah, Who with His Name nothing can cause harm in the earth nor in the heavens, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: رَضِيتُ بِاللهِ رَبًّا وَبِالْإِسْلاَمِ دِيناً وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ نَبِيَّا
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Radheetu billaahi Rabban, wa bil-'Islaami deenan, wa bi-Muhammadin (sallallaahu 'alayhi wa sallama) Nabiyyan.
Hadith-164.Translation: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion and with Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as my Prophet. Allah has promised that anyone who says this three times every morning or evening will be pleased on the Day of Resurrection.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ أَسْتَغِيثُ أَصْلِحْ لِي شَأْنِي كُلَّهُ وَلَا تَكِلْنِي إِلَى نَفْسِي طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Yaa Hayyu yaa Qayyoomu birahmatika 'astagheethu 'aslih lee sha'nee kullahu wa laa takilnee 'ilaa nafsee tarfata 'aynin.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Ever Living One, O Eternal One, by Your mercy I call on You to set right all my affairs. Do not place me in charge of my soul even for the blinking of an eye (i.e. a moment).

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ للهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ: فَتْحَهُ وَنَصْرَهُ وَنُورَهُ وَبَرَكَتَهُ وَهُدَاهُ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيهِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: 'Asbahnaa wa 'asbahal-mulku lillaahi Rabbil-'aalameen, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayra haathal-yawmi: Fathahu wa nasrahu wa noorahu, wa barakatahu, wa hudaahu, wa'a'oothu bika min sharri maafeehi wa sharri maa ba'dahu.
Hadith-164.Translation: We have entered a new day and with it all the dominion which belongs to Allah, Lord of all that exists. O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of this day, its victory, its help, its light, its blessings, and its guidance. I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in it and from the evil that follows it.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: أَمْسَيْناَ وَأَمْسَى الْمُلْكُ للهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ: فتْحَهَا وَنَصْرَهَا وَنوُرَهَا وَبَرَكَتَهَا وَهُدَاهَا وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيهَا وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayra haathihil-laylati Fathahu wa nasrahu wa noorahu, wa barakatahu, wa hudaahu, wa'a'oothu bika min sharri maafeehi wa sharri maa ba'dahu.
Hadith-164.Translation: My Lord, I ask You for the good things of this night. And with it all the dominion which belongs to Allah, Lord of all that exists. O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of this night its victory, its help, its light, its blessings, and its guidance. I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in it and from the evil that follows it.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: أَصْبَحْنا عَلَى فِطْرَةِ الْإِسْلاَمِ وَعَلَى كَلِمَةِ الْإِخْلاَصِ وَعَلَى دِينِ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ وَعَلَى مِلَّةِ أَبِينَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ حَنِيفًا مُسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشرِكِينَ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: 'Asbahnaa 'alaa fitratil-'Islaami wa 'alaa kalimatil-'ikhlaasi, wa 'alaa deeni Nabiyyinaa Muhammadin (sallallaahu 'alayhi wa sallama), wa 'alaa millati 'abeenaa 'Ibraaheema, haneefan Musliman wa maa kaana minal-mushrikeen.
Hadith-164.Translation: We have entered a new day  upon the natural religion of Islam, the word of sincere devotion, the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and the faith of our father Ibrahim. He was upright (in worshipping Allah), and a Muslim. He was not of those who worship others besides Allah.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Subhaanallaahi wa bihamdihi.
Hadith-164.Translation: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
Hadith-164.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things. Allah will write ten Hasanaat (rewards) for whoever recites this ten times in the morning, and forgive him ten misdeeds and give him the reward of freeing ten slaves and protect him from Satan. Whoever recites this ten times in the evening will get this same reward.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ عَدَدَ خَلْقِهِ وَرِضَا نَفْسِهِ وَزِنَةَ عَرْشِهِ وَمِدَادَ كَلِمَاتِهِ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Subhaanallaahi wa bihamdihi: 'Adada khalqihi, wa ridhaa nafsihi, wa zinata 'arshihi wa midaada kalimaatihi.
Hadith-164.Translation: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His Pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His Words.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا وَعَمَلاً مُتقَبٌلاً
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka 'ilman naafi'an, wa rizqan tayyiban, wa 'amalan mutaqabbalan.
Hadith-164.Translation: O Allah, I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit, a good provision, and deeds that will be accepted.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: أسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: 'Astaghfirullaaha wa 'atoobu 'ilayhi.
Hadith-164.Translation: I seek the forgiveness of Allah and repent to Him.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: 'A'oothu bikalimaatil-laahit-taammaati min sharri maa khalaqa.
Hadith-164.Translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.

Hadith-164.Title: Remembrance said in the morning and evening
Hadith-164.Text: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَسَلِّمْ عَلَى نَبَيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ
Hadith-164.Transliteration: Allahumma salli wa sallim 'alaa nabiyyinaa Muhammadin.
Hadith-164.Translation: Oh Allah, we ask you for peace and blessings upon our prophet Muhammad.

Hadith-157.Title: Returning a supplication after having bestowed a gift or charity upon someone

Hadith-190.Title: Seeking forgiveness and repentance
Hadith-190.Text: أسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ الْعَظِيمَ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيهِ
Hadith-190.Translation: Allah's Messenger (Peace and blessings be upon him) said: By Allah, I seek the forgiveness of Allah, and repent to Him more than seventy times in a day.

Hadith-188.Title: Stopping or lodging somewhere
Hadith-188.Text: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ

Hadith-263.Title: Supplication of the resident for the traveller
Hadith-263.Text: أسْتَوْدِعُ اللهَ دِينَكَ وَأَمَانَتَكَ وَخَوَاتِيمَ عَمَلِكَ
Hadith-263.Translation: I leave your religion in the care of Allah, as well as your safety, and the last of your deeds.

Hadith-263.Title: Supplication of the resident for the traveller
Hadith-263.Text: زَوَّدَكَ اللهُ التَّقْوَى وَغَفَرَ ذَنْبَكَ وَيَسَّرَ لَكَ الْخَيْرَ حَيْثُ ما كُنْتَ
Hadith-263.Transliteration: Zawwadakal-laahut-taqwaa, wa ghafara thanbaka, wa yassara lakal-khayra haythu maa kunta.

Hadith-192.Title: Supplication of the traveller for the resident
Hadith-192.Text: أسْتَوْدِعُكُمُ اللهَ الَّذِي لاَ تَضِيعُ وَدَائِعُهُ
Hadith-192.Translation: I leave you in the care of Allah, as nothing is lost that is in His care.

Surah-20.Title: Taha 20:45
Surah-20.Text: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفۡرُطَ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوۡ أَن يَطۡغَىٰ
Surah-20.Transliteration: rabbana innana nakhafu an yafruta alayna aw an yatgha
Surah-20.Translation: Our Lord! Indeed we fear that he will hasten against us or that he will transgress

Hadith-113.Title: The Day of 'Arafah
Hadith-113.Text: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
Hadith-113.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
Hadith-113.Translation: The best invocation is that of the Day of Arafat, and the best that anyone can say is what I and the Prophets before me have said: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.

Hadith-97.Title: The Talbiya for the one doing Hajj or Umrah
Hadith-97.Text: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ لَبَّيْكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ وَالنِّعْمَةَ لَكَ وَالْمُلْكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ
Hadith-97.Transliteration: Labbayk Allaahumma labbayk, labbayk laa shareeka laka labbayk, 'innal-hamda, wanni'mata, laka walmulk, laa shareeka laka.
Hadith-97.Translation: I am here at Your service, O Allah, I am here at Your service. I am here at Your service, You have no partner, I am here at Your service. Surely the praise, and blessings are Yours, and the dominion. You have no partner.

Hadith-170.Title: The Tashahhud
Hadith-170.Text: التَّحِيَّاتُ للهِ وَالصَّلَواتُ وَالطَّيِّباتُ السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى عِبَادِ اللهِ الصَّالِحِينَ. أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ
Hadith-170.Transliteration: Attahiyyaatu lillahi wassalawaatu, wattayyibaatu, assalaamu 'alayka 'ayyuhan-Nabiyyu wa rahmatullaahi wa barakaatuhu, assalamu 'alayna wa 'alaa 'ibadillahis-saaliheen. 'Ash-hadu 'an laa 'illaha 'illallaahu wa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluhu.
Hadith-170.Translation: All greetings of humility are for Allah, and all prayers and goodness. Peace be upon yo, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous slaves of Allah. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.

Hadith-159.Title: To someone wearing a new garment
Hadith-159.Translation: May Allah replace it when it is worn out.

Hadith-159.Title: To someone wearing a new garment
Hadith-159.Text: اِلْبَسْ جَدِيدًا وَعِشْ حَمِيدًا وَمُتْ شَهِيدًا
Hadith-159.Transliteration: Ilbas jadeedan, wa 'ish hameedan, wa mut shaheedan.
Hadith-159.Translation: Put on new clothes, live a praise-worthy life and die as a martyr.

Hadith-46.Title: To the newlywed
Hadith-46.Text: بَارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ وَبَارَكَ علَيْكَ وَجَمَعَ بَيْنَكُمَا فِي خَيْرٍ
Hadith-46.Transliteration: Baarakallaahu laka, wa baaraka 'alayka, wa jama'a baynakumaa fee khayrin.
Hadith-46.Translation: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and join you together in goodness.

Hadith-119.Title: To ward off the deception of the obstinate devils
Hadith-119.Text: أعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ الَّتِي لاَ يُجَاوِزُهُنَّ بَرٌّ وَلاَ فاَجِرٌ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ وَبَرَأ وَذَرَأ وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُجُ فيهَا وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وَمِنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طَارِقٍ إِلاَّ طَارِقاً يَطْرُقُ بِخَيْرٍ يَا رَحْمَنُ
Hadith-119.Transliteration: 'A'oothu bikalimaatil-laahit-taammaatil-latee laa yujaawizuhunna barrun wa laa faajirun min sharri maa khalaqa, wa bara'a wa thara'a, wa min sharri maa yanzilu minas-samaa'i, wa min sharri maa ya'ruju feehaa, wa min sharri maa thara'a fil-'ardhi, wa min sharri ma yakhruju minhaa, wa min sharri fitanil-layli wannahaari, wa min sharri kulli taariqin 'illaa taariqan yatruqu bikhayrin yaa Rahmaan.
Hadith-119.Translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah -which neither the upright nor the corrupt may overcome - from the evil of what He created, of what He made, and of what He scattered, from the evil of what descends from the heavens, and of what rises up to them, from the evil of what He scattered in the earth and of what emerges from it, from the evil trials of night and day, and from the evil of every night visitor, except the night visitor who comes with good. O Merciful One.

Hadith-35.Title: Upon being afraid of something or feeling anxious while dreaming
Hadith-35.Text: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ غَضَبِهِ وَعِقَابِهِ، وَشَرِّ عِبَادِهِ، وَمِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِينِ وَأَنْ يَحْضُرُونِ
Hadith-35.Transliteration: 'A'oothu bikalimaatil-laahit-taammaati min ghadhabihi wa 'iqaabihi, wa sharri 'ibaadihi, wa min hamazaatish-shayaateeni wa 'an yahdhuroon.
Hadith-35.Translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from His anger and His punishment, from the evil of His slaves and from the taunts of devils and from their presence.

Hadith-242.Title: Upon being angry
Hadith-242.Translation: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast from that which You provide for us.

Hadith-152.Title: Upon breaking fast
Hadith-152.Text: ذَهَبَ الظَّمَأُ وَابْتَلَّتِ الْعُرُوقُ وَثَبَتَ الْأَجْرُ إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ
Hadith-152.Translation: The thirst is gone, the veins are moistened and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.

Hadith-152.Title: Upon breaking fast
Hadith-152.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِرَحْمَتِكَ الَّتِي وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَنْ تَغْفِرَ لِي
Hadith-152.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka birahmatikal-latee wasi'at kulla shay'in 'an taghfira lee.
Hadith-152.Translation: O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy, which encompasses all things, that You forgive me.

Hadith-144.Title: Upon breaking fast in someone's home
Hadith-144.Text: أَفْطَرَ عِنْدَكُمُ الصَّائِمُونَ وَ أَكَلَ طَعَامَكُمُ الْأَبْرَارُ وَصَلَّتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ
Hadith-144.Translation: With you, those who are fasting have broken their fast, you have fed those who are righteous, and the angels recite their prayers upon you.

Hadith-43.Title: Upon completing the ablution
Hadith-43.Text: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ
Hadith-43.Transliteration: 'Ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu wa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluhu.
Hadith-43.Translation: I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner; and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.

Hadith-43.Title: Upon completing the ablution
Hadith-43.Text: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِي مِنَ التَّوَّابِينَ وَاجْعَلْنِي مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرٍينَ
Hadith-43.Translation: O Allah, make me among those who turn to You in repentance, and make me among those who are purified.

Hadith-43.Title: Upon completing the ablution
Hadith-43.Text: سُبْحَانَ نَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتوبُ إِلَيْكَ
Hadith-43.Transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma wa bihamdika, 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, 'astaghfiruka wa 'atoobu 'ilayk.
Hadith-43.Translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise; I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance.

Hadith-160.Title: Upon completing the meal
Hadith-160.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنِي هَذَا وَرَزَقَنِيهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلاَ قُوَّةٍ
Hadith-160.Transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-lathee 'at'amanee haathaa, wa razaqaneehi, min ghayri hawlin minnee wa laa quwwatin.
Hadith-160.Translation: Praise is to Allah Who has given me this food and sustained me with it though I was unable to doit and powerless.

Hadith-160.Title: Upon completing the meal
Hadith-160.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ حَمْدًا كَثِيرًا طَيِّبًا مُباَرَكًا فِيهِ غَيْرَ { مَكْفِيٍّ وَلاَ } مُوَدَّعٍ وَلاَ مُسْتَغْنًى عَنْهُ رَبنَّاَ
Hadith-160.Transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahi hamdan katheeran tayyiban mubaarakan feehi, ghayra [makfiyyin wa laa] muwadda'in, wa laa mustaghnan 'anhu Rabbanaa.
Hadith-160.Translation: All praise is to Allah, praise in abundance, good and blessed. It cannot [be compensated for, nor can it] be left, nor can it be done without, our Lord.

Hadith-122.Title: Upon entering the home
Hadith-122.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ وَلَجْنَا وَبِسْمِ اللهِ خَرَجْنَا وَعَلَى اللهِ رَبِّنَا تَوَكَّلْنَا
Hadith-122.Transliteration: Bismillaahi walajnaa, wa bismillaahi kharajnaa, wa 'alaaRabblnaa tawakkalnaa.
Hadith-122.Translation: In the Name of Allah we enter, in the Name of Allah we leave, and upon our Lord we depend.

Hadith-57.Title: Upon entering the market
Hadith-57.Text: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ وَهُوَ حَيٌّ لاَ يَمُوتُ بِيَدِهِ الْخَيْرُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
Hadith-57.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, yuhyee wa yumeetu, wa Huwa hayyun laa yamootu, biyadihil-khayru, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
Hadith-57.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death, and He is living and does not die. In His Hand is all good, and He is Able to do all things.

Hadith-59.Title: Upon entering the mosque
Hadith-59.Text: أَعُوذُ بِاللهِ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِوَجْهِهِ الْكَرِيمِ وَ سُلْطَانِهِ الْقَدِيمِ مِنَ الشَّيْطًانِ الرَّجِيمِ
Hadith-59.Transliteration: 'A'oothu billaahil-'Adheem, wa bi-Wajhihil-Kareem, wa Sultaanihil-qadeem, minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
Hadith-59.Translation: I seek refuge in Almighty Allah, by His Noble Face, by His primordial power, from Satan the outcast.

Hadith-59.Title: Upon entering the mosque
Hadith-59.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ وَالصَّلاَةُ وَالسَّلاَمُ عَلَى رَسُولِ اللهِ اللَّهُمَّ افْتَحْ لِي أَبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ
Hadith-59.Transliteration: Bismillaahi, wassalaatu. Wassalaamu 'alaaRasoolillaahi. Allaahum-maftah lee 'abwaaba rahmatika.
Hadith-59.Translation: In the Name of Allah, and blessings. And peace be upon the Messenger of Allah. O Allah, open before me the doors of Your mercy.

Hadith-255.Title: Upon entering the village or town
Hadith-255.Text: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَمَا أَظْلَلْنَ وَرَبَّ الْأَرَضِينَ السَّبْع وَمَا أَقْلَلْنَ وَرَبَّ الشَّيَاطِينِ وَمَا أَضْلَلْنَ وَرَبَّ الرِّيَاحِ وَمَا ذَرَيْنَ فَإِنَّا نَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ وَخَيْرَ أهْلِهَا وَنَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَشَرِّ أَهْلِهَا وَشَرِّ مَا فِيهَا
Hadith-255.Transliteration: Allaahumma Rabbas-samaawaatis-sab'i wa maa 'adhlalna, wa Rabbal-'aradheenas-sab'i wa maa 'aqlalna, wa Rabbash-shayaateeni wa maa 'adhlalna, wa Rabbar-riyaahi wa maa tharayna.'As'aluka khayra haathihil-qaryati wa khayra 'ahlihaa, wa khayra maafeehaa, wa 'a'oothu bika min sharrihaa, wa sharri 'ahlihaa, wa shard maa feehaa.
Hadith-255.Translation: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and all they overshadow, Lord of the seven worlds and all they uphold, Lord of the devils and all they lead astray, Lord of the winds and all they scatter. I ask You for the goodness of this town and for the goodness of its people, and for the goodness it contains. I seek refuge in You from its evil, from the evil of its people and from the evil it contains.

Hadith-136.Title: Upon hearing the barking of dogs at night
Hadith-136.Translation: When you hear a dog barking or a donkey braying in the night, then seek refuge in Allah from them, for surely they have seen what you see not.

Hadith-68.Title: Upon hearing the cock crows or the donkey roars
Hadith-68.Translation: When you hear the cock's crow, ask Allah for His favor upon you for surely it has seen an angel. When you hear the bray of a donkey, seek refuge in Allah from Satan, for surely it has seen a devil.

Hadith-174.Title: Upon hearing thunder
Hadith-174.Text: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي يُسَبِّحُ الرَّعْدُ بِحَمْدِهِ وَالْمَلاَئِكةُ مِنْ خِيفَتِهِ
Hadith-174.Transliteration: Subhaanal-lathee yusabbihur-ra'du bihamdihi walmalaa'ikatu min kheefatihi.
Hadith-174.Translation: Glory is to Him Whom thunder and angels glorify due to fear of Him.

Hadith-163.Title: Upon leaving the mosque
Hadith-163.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ وَالصَّلاَةُ وَالسَّلاَمُ عَلَى رَسُولِ اللهِ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ اللَّهُمَّ اعْصِمْنِي مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
Hadith-163.Transliteration: Bismillaahi wassalaatu wassalaamu 'alaa Rasoolillaahi, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka min fadhlika, Allaahumma'simnee minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
Hadith-163.Translation: In the Name of Allah, and peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah. O Allah, I ask for Your favor, O Allah, protect me from Satan the outcast.

Hadith-145.Title: Upon meeting enemies and unjust rulers
Hadith-145.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَجْعَلُكَ فِي نُحُورِهِم وَنَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شُرُورِهِمْ
Hadith-145.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innaa naj'aluka fee nuhoorihim wa na'oothu bika min shuroorihim.
Hadith-145.Translation: O Allah, we ask You to restrain them by their necks and we seek refuge in You from their evil.

Hadith-145.Title: Upon meeting enemies and unjust rulers
Hadith-145.Text: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ عَضُدِي وَأَنْتَ نَصِيرِي بِكَ أَحُولُ وَبِكَ أَصُولُ وَبِكَ أُقاتِلُ
Hadith-145.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'Anta 'adhudee, wa 'Anta naseeree, bika 'ajoolu, wa bika 'asoolu, wa bika 'uqaatilu.
Hadith-145.Translation: O Allah, You are my strength and You are my support. For Your sake I go forth and for Your sake I advance and for Your sake I fight.

Hadith-145.Title: Upon meeting enemies and unjust rulers
Hadith-145.Translation: Allah is sufficient for us and the best of those on whom to depend.

Hadith-225.Title: Upon rising from the bowing position
Upon rising from the bowing position
Hadith-225.Text: رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ حَمْدًا كَثِيرًا طَيِّبًا مُبَارَكًا فِيهِ
Hadith-225.Transliteration: Rabbana wa lakal-hamd, hamdan i katheeran tayyiban mubaaarakanfeeh.
Hadith-225.Translation: Our Lord, praise is Yours, abundant, good and blessed praise.

Hadith-225.Title: Upon rising from the bowing position
Hadith-225.Text: رَبَّنَا لَكَ الْحَمْدُ مِلْءَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَمِلْءَ الْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمِلْءَ مَا شِئْتَ مِنْ شَيءٍ بَعْدُ أَهْلَ الثَّناءِ وَالْمَجْدِ أَحَقُّ مَا قَالَ الْعَبْدُ وَكُلُّنَا لَكَ عَبْدٌ اللَّهُمَّ لاَ مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ وَلاَ مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ وَلاَ يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
Hadith-225.Transliteration: Rabbana lakal-hamdu mil'as-samawaati wa mU'al-'ardhi wa maa baynahumaa, wa mil'a maa shi'ta min shay'in ba'd. 'Ahlath-thanaa'i walmajdi, 'ahaqqu maa qaalal-'abdu, wa kullunaa laka 'abdun. Allahumma laa maani'a limaa 'a'tayta, wa laa mu'tiya limaa mana'ta, wa laa yanfa'uthal-jaddi minkal-jadd.
Hadith-225.Translation: (A praise that) fills the heaven and the earth and what lies between them, and whatever else You  please. (You Allah) are the most worthy of praise and majesty, and what the slave has said - we are all Your slaves. O Allah,there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld. And the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You.

Hadith-52.Title: Upon seeing someone ill
Hadith-52.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي عَافَانِي مِمَّا ابْتَلاَكَ بِهِ وَفَضَّلَنِي عَلَى كَثِيرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضِيلًا
Hadith-52.Transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-lathee 'aafaanee mimmab-talaaka bihi wa fadhdhalanee 'alaa katheerin mimman khalaqa tafdheela.
Hadith-52.Translation: Praise is to Allah Who has spared me what He has afflicted you with, and preferred me greatly above much of what He has created.

Hadith-39.Title: Upon seeing the first fruits
Hadith-39.Text: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِي ثَمَرِنَا وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مَدِينَتِنَا وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي صَاعِنَا وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مُدِّنَا
Hadith-39.Transliteration: Allahumma baarik lanaa fee thamarinaa, wa baarik lanaa fee madeenatinaa wa baarik lanaa fee saa'inaa, wa baarik lanaa fee muddinaa.
Hadith-39.Translation: O Allah, bless us in our dates and bless us in our town, bless us in our Sa' and in our Mudd.

Hadith-84.Title: Upon seeing the new moon
Hadith-84.Text: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ اللَّهُمَّ أَهِلَّهُ عَلَيْنَا بِالْأَمْنِ وَالْإِيمَانِ وَالسَّلاَمَةِ وَالْإِسْلاَمِ وَالتَّوْفِيقِ لِمَا تُحِبُّ رَبَّنَا وَتَرْضَى رَبُّنَا وَرَبُّكَ اللهُ
Hadith-84.Transliteration: Allaahu 'Akbar, Allaahu 'Akbar, Allaahu 'Akbar, Allaahumma 'ahillahu 'alayna bil'amni wal'eemaani, wassalaamati wal-'Islaami, wattawfeeqi limaa tuhibbu Rabbanaa wa tardhaa, Rabbunaa wa Rabbukallaahu.
Hadith-84.Translation: Allah is the Most Great. O Allah, bring us the new moon with security and Faith, with peace and in Islam, and in harmony with what our Lord loves and what pleases Him. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.

Hadith-104.Title: Upon sneezing
Hadith-104.Translation: When you sneeze, then say: All praises and thanks are to Allah.Your companion should say: May Allah have mercy upon you.When someone says Yarhamukallaah to you then you should say: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.

Hadith-88.Title: Upon visiting someone who is ill
Hadith-88.Text: لاَ بأْسَ طَهُورٌ إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ
Hadith-88.Translation: Do not worry, it will be a purification (for you), Allah willing.

Hadith-88.Title: Upon visiting someone who is ill
Hadith-88.Text: أَسْأَلُ اللهَ الْعَظِيمَ رَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ أَنْ يَشْفِيَكَ
Hadith-88.Translation: I ask Almighty Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, to make you well.

Hadith-256.Title: Visiting the graves
Hadith-256.Text: السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الدِّيَارِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُسْلِمِينَ وَإِنَّا إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ بِكُمْ لاَحِقُونَ { وَيَرْحَمُ اللهُ الْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنَّا وَالْمُسْتأْخِرِينَ } أَسْاَلُ اللهَ لَنَا وَلَكُمُ الْعَافِيَةَ
Hadith-256.Transliteration: Assalaamu 'alaykum 'ahlad-diyaari, minal-mu'mineena walmuslimeena, wa 'innaa 'in shaa' Allaahu bikum laahiqoona [wa yarhamullaahul-mustaqdimeena minnaa walmusta'khireena] 'as'alullaaha lanaa wa lakumul- 'aafiyata.
Hadith-256.Translation: Peace be upon you, people of this abode, from among the believers and those who are Muslims, and we, by the Will of Allah, shall be joining you. [May Allah have mercy on the first of us and the last of us] I ask Allah to grant us and you strength.

Hadith-56.Title: What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news
Hadith-56.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ
Hadith-56.Translation: Praise is to Allah Who by His blessings all good things are perfected.

Hadith-56.Title: What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news
Hadith-56.Translation: Praise is to Allah in all circumstances.

Hadith-241.Title: What to say when being scolded while fasting
Hadith-241.Translation: I am fasting. I am fasting.

Hadith-260.Title: What words should be prompted to a dying person
Hadith-260.Transliteration: 'Innaa lillaahi wa 'innaa 'ilayhi raaji'oon, Allaahumma'-jurni fee museebatee wa 'akhliflee khayran minhaa.
Hadith-260.Translation: Whoever dies with the last words :'There is none worthy of worship but Allah," will enter Paradise

Hadith-235.Title: When a misbeliever praises Allah after sneezing
Hadith-235.Translation: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.

Hadith-3.Title: When at Mount Safa and Mount Marwah
Hadith-3.Text: إنَّ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَائِرِ اللهِ أبْدَأُ بِمَا بَدَأ اللهُ بِهِ
Hadith-3.Transliteration: 'Innas-Safaa wal-Marwata min sha'aa'irillaah.'Abda'u bimaa bada'allaahu bihi.
Hadith-3.Translation: Whenever the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) approached Mount Safa, he would recite: Surely Safa and Marwah are among the signs of Allah. I begin by that which Allah began.He began (his Sa'y) at Mount Safa climbing it until he could see the House.

Hadith-3.Title: When at Mount Safa and Mount Marwah
Hadith-3.Text: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ أللهُ أكْبَرُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ أنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُ
Hadith-3.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaah, Allaahu 'AkbarThere is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great.Then he said:Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu ilahaahu, 'anjaza wa'dahu, wa nasara 'abdahu, wa hazamal 'ahzaaba wahdahu.
Hadith-3.Translation: He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated Confederates.Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same thing like this three times. He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.

Hadith-69.Title: When being afraid of a group of people
Hadith-69.Translation: O Allah, suffice me against them however You wish.

Hadith-149.Title: When feeling some pain in the body
Hadith-149.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ  أعُوذُ بِاللهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا أَجِدُ وَأُحَاذِرُ
Hadith-149.Transliteration: Bismillaah, Bismillaah, Bismillaah.'A'oothu billaahi wa qudratihi min sharri maa 'ajidu wa 'uhaathiru.
Hadith-149.Translation: Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say: With the Name of Allah (three times). Then say: I seek refuge in Allah and in His Power from the evil of what I find and of what I guard against.

Hadith-257.Title: When going to the mosque
Hadith-257.Text: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ فِي قَلْبِي نُورًا وَفِي لِسَانِي نُورًا وَفِي سَمْعِي نُورًا وَفِي بَصَرِي نُورًا وَمِنْ فَوْقِي نُورًا وَمِنْ تَحْتِي نُورًا وَعَنْ يَمِينِي نُورًا وَعَنْ شِمَالِي نُورًا وَمِنْ أَمَامِي نُورًا وَمِنْ خَلْفِي نُورًا وَاجْعَلْ فِي نَفْسِي نُورًا وَأَعْظِمْ لِي نُورًا وَعَظِّم لِي نُورًا وَاجْعَلْ لِي نُورًا وَاجْعَلْنِي نُورًا اللَّهُمَّ أَعْطِنِي نُورًا وَاجْعَلْ فِي عَصَبِي نُورًا وَفِي لَحْمِي نُورًا وَفِي دَمِي نُورًا وَفِي شَعْرِي نُورًا وَفِي بَشَرِي نُورًا
Hadith-257.Transliteration: Allaahummaj'al fee qalbee nooran, wa fee lisaaanee nooran, wa fee sam'ee nooran, wa fee basaree nooran, wa min fawqee nooran, wa min tahtee nooran, wa 'an yameenee nooran, wa 'an shimaalee nooran, wa min 'amaamee nooran, wa min khalfee nooran, waj'alfee nafsee nooran, wa 'a'dhim lee nooran, wa 'adhdhim lee nooran, wafal lee nooran, waj'alnee nooran, Allaahumma 'a'tinee nooran, waj'al fee 'asabee nooran, wafee lahmee nooran, wafee damee nooran, wa fee sha'ree nooran, wa fee basharee nooran. Allaahummaj'al lee nooran fee qabree wa nooran fee 'idhaamee. Wa zidnee nooran, wa zidnee nooran, wa zidnee nooran. Wa hab lee nooran 'alaa noor.
Hadith-257.Translation: O Allah, place light in my heart, and on my tongue light, and in my ears light and in my sight light, and above me light, and below me light, and to my right light, and to my left light, and before me light and behind me light. Place in my soul light. Magnify for me light, and amplify for me light. Make for me light and make me a light. O Allah, grant me light, and place light in my nerves, and in my body light and in my blood light and in my hair light and in my skin light. O Allah, make for me a light in my grave and a light in my bones. Increase me in light, increase me in light, increase me in light. Grant me light upon light.

Hadith-138.Title: When leaving the home
Hadith-138.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللهِ لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللهِ
Hadith-138.Transliteration: Bismillaahi, tawakkaltu 'alallaahi, wa laa hawla wa laa quwwata ‘ illaa billaah.
Hadith-138.Translation: In the Name of Allah, I have placed my trust in Allah, there is no might and no power except by Allah.

Hadith-138.Title: When leaving the home
Hadith-138.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ أَوْ أُضَلَّ أَوْ أَزِلَّ أَوْ أُزَلَّ أَوْ أَظْلِمَ أَوْ أُظْلَمَ أَوْ أَجْهَلَ أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ
Hadith-138.Translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I misguide others, or I am misguided by others, lest I cause others to err or I am caused to err, lest I abuse others or be abused, and lest I behave foolishly or meet with the foolishness of others.

Hadith-54.Title: When prostrating due to recitation of the Quran
Hadith-54.Text: سَجَدَ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي خَلَقَهُ وَشَقَّ سَمْعَهُ وَبَصَرَهُ بِحَوْلِهِ وَقُوَّتِهِ فتَبَاَرَكَ اللهُ أحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِينَ
Hadith-54.Transliteration: Sajada wajhiya lillathe khalaqahu, wa shaqqa sam'ahu wa basarahu bihawlihi wa quwwatihi. Fatabaarakallahu 'ahsanul-khaliqeen.
Hadith-54.Translation: I have prostrated my face to the One Who created it, and gave it hearing and sight by His might and His power, Glory is to Allah, the Best of creators.

Hadith-54.Title: When prostrating due to recitation of the Quran
Hadith-54.Text: اللَّهُمَّ اكْتُبْ لِي بِهاَ عِنْدَكَ أَجْرًا وَضَعْ عَنِّي بِهاَ وِزْرًا وَاجْعَلْهَا لِي عِنْدَكَ ذُخْرًا وَتَقَبَّلْهَا مِنِّي كَاَم تَقَبَّلْتَهَا مِنْ عَبْدِكَ دَاوُدَ
Hadith-54.Transliteration: Allahum-maktub lee bihaa 'indaka 'ajran, wa aha''annee bihaa wizran, waj'alhaa lee 'indaka thukhran, wa taqabbalhaa minnee kamaa taqabbaltahaa min'abdika Dawwooda.
Hadith-54.Translation: O Allah, write it as a reward for me, and release me from a burden for it, and make it a treasure for me in Paradise. Accept it from me as You accepted it fom your servant Dawud.

Hadith-33.Title: When putting on clothes
Hadith-33.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي كَسَانِي هَذَا الثَّوْبَ وَرَزَقَنِيهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلاَ قُوَّةٍ
Hadith-33.Transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-lathee kasaanee haathaa (aththawba) wa razaqaneehi min ghayri hawlim-minnee wa laa quwwatin.
Hadith-33.Translation: Praise is to Allah Who has clothed me with this (garment) and provided it for me, though I was powerless myself and incapable.

Hadith-227.Title: When putting on new clothes
Hadith-227.Text: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ أَنْتَ كَسَوْتَنِيهِ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهُ وَخَيْرَ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهِ وَشَرِّ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ
Hadith-227.Transliteration: Allaahumma lakal-hamdu 'Anta kasawtaneehi, 'as'aluka min khayrihi wa khayri maa suni'a lahu, wa 'a'oothu bika min sharrihi wa sharri ma suni'a lahu.
Hadith-227.Translation: O Allah, praise is to You. You have clothed me. I ask You for its goodness and the goodness of what it has been made for, and I seek Your protection from the evil of it and the evil of what it has been made for.

Hadith-53.Title: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice
Hadith-53.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ وَاللهُ أَكْبَرُ { اللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ وَلَكَ } اللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّي
Hadith-53.Transliteration: Bismillaahi wallaahu 'Akbar [Allaahumma minka wa laka] Allaahumma taqabbal minnee.
Hadith-53.Translation: With the Name of Allah, Allah is the Most Great! [O Allah, from You and to You.] O Allah, accept it from me.

Hadith-90.Title: When stricken with a mishap or overtaken by an affair
Hadith-90.Translation: It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills.

Hadith-98.Title: When turning over during the night
Hadith-98.Text: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ رَبُّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ
Hadith-98.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahul-Waahidul-Qahhaaru, Rabbus-samaawaati wal'ardhi wa maa baynahumal-'Azeezul-Ghaffaaru.
Hadith-98.Translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, the One, the Victorious, Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the All-Forgiving.

Hadith-238.Title: When waking up
Hadith-238.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ
Hadith-238.Translation: Praise is to Allah Who brought us to life after putting us to death and to Whom we will return after resurrection.

Hadith-238.Title: When waking up
Hadith-238.Text: لاَ إلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ علَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ َقدِيرٌ سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَاْلحَمْدُ للهِ وَلاَ إلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَاللهُ أكْبَرُ وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَ بِاللهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيِمِ رَبِّ اغْفْرْ لِي
Hadith-238.Transliteration: Laa 'illaha 'illallahu wahdahu la shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer Subhaanallahi, walhamdu lillaahi, wa laa 'ilaha 'illallahu, wallaahu 'akbar, wa laa hawla wa laa Quwwata 'illaa billaahil-'Aliyyil-'Adheem, Rabbighfir lee.
Hadith-238.Translation: There is no god but Allah that has no companion. He who has all the power; praise Him - He is Almighty. Allah is Glorious. Praise to Allah, there is no god but Allah. Allah is the Greatest. None but Allah, the Exalted, the Greatest, has power and strength. My Lord, forgive me!

Hadith-238.Title: When waking up
Hadith-238.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي عَافَانِي فِي جَسَدِي وَرَدَّ عَلَيَّ رُوحِي وَأَذِنَ لِي بِذِكْرِهِ
Hadith-238.Transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-lathee 'aafaanee fee jasadee, wa radda 'alayya roohee, wa 'athina lee bithikrihi.
Hadith-238.Translation: Praise is to Allah Who gave strength to my body and returned me my soul and allowed me to remember Him.

Hadith-248.Title: When you are scared
Hadith-248.Translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah!

Hadith-34.Title: While bestriding an animal or riding any kind of transport
Hadith-34.Text: بِسْمِ اللهِ بِسْمِ اللهِ بِسْمِ اللهِ الْحَمْدُ للهِ سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ وَإنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنْقَلِبُونَ
Hadith-34.Transliteration: Bismillaah, Alhamdu lillaah. Subhaanal-lathee sakhkhara lanaa haathaa wa maa kunnaa lahu muqrineen. Wa 'innaa 'ilaa Rabbinaa lamunqaliboon.
Hadith-34.Translation: With the Name of Allah. Praise is to Allah. Glory is to Him Who has provided this for us though we could never have had it by our efforts. Surely, unto our Lord we are returning.

Hadith-34.Title: While bestriding an animal or riding any kind of transport
Hadith-34.Text: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الْحَمْدُ للهِ الْحَمْدُ للهِ اللهُ أكْبَرُ اللهُ أكْبَرُ اللهُ أكْبَرُ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي قَدْ ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي فاَغْفِرْ لِي فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنوُبَ إِلاَّ أنْتَ
Hadith-34.Transliteration: Alhamdu lillaah, alhamdu lillaah, alhamdu lillaah, Allaahu 'Akbar, Allaahu 'Akbar, Allaahu 'Akbar, subhaanakal-laahumma 'innee dhalamtu nafsee faghfir lee, fa'innahu laa yaghfiruth-thunooba 'illaa 'Anta.
Hadith-34.Translation: Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Glory is to You. O Allah, I have wronged my own soul. Forgive me, for surely none forgives sins but You.

Hadith-178.Title: While bowing in prayer
Hadith-178.Translation: Glory to my Lord the Exalted

Hadith-178.Title: While bowing in prayer
Hadith-178.Text: سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي
Hadith-178.Transliteration: Subhaanaka Allahumma Rabbana wa bihamdika Allahum-maghfir lee.
Hadith-178.Translation: Glory is to You, o Allah, our Lord, and Praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me.

Hadith-178.Title: While bowing in prayer
Hadith-178.Translation: Glory (to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the Angels and the Spirit.

Hadith-178.Title: While bowing in prayer
Hadith-178.Text: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ رَكَعْتُ وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ وَلَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ خَشَعَ لَكَ سَمْعِي وَبَصَرِي وَمُخِّي وَعَظْمِي وَعَصَبِي وَمَا استَقَلَّتْ بِهِ قَدَمِي
Hadith-178.Transliteration: Allahumma laka raka'tu, wa bika 'aamantu, wa laka 'aslamtu khasha'a laka sam'ee, wa basaree,wa mukhkhee, wa 'asabee, wa mastaqalla bihi qadamee.
Hadith-178.Translation: O Allah, to You I bow (in prayer) and in You I believe and to You I have submitted. Before You my hearing is humbled, as is my sight, my mind, my bones, my nerves and what my feet have mounted upon (for travel).

Hadith-178.Title: While bowing in prayer
Hadith-178.Text: سُبْحَانَ ذِي الْجَبَرُوتِ وَالْمَلَكُوتِ وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ وَالْعَظَمَةِ
Hadith-178.Translation: Glory is to You, Master of power, of domimion. of majesty and greatness.

Hadith-121.Title: While prostrating (sujood)
Hadith-121.Translation: Glory is to my Lord, the Most High.

Hadith-121.Title: While prostrating (sujood)
Hadith-121.Text: سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي
Hadith-121.Transliteration: Subhaanaka Allahumma Rabbanaa wa bihamdika Allahum-maghfir lee.
Hadith-121.Translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me.

Hadith-121.Title: While prostrating (sujood)
Hadith-121.Translation: Glory ( to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the angels and the Spirit.

Hadith-121.Title: While prostrating (sujood)
Hadith-121.Text: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ سَجَدْتُ وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ وَلَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ سَجَدَ وَجْهِي لِلَّذِي خَلَقَهُ وَصَوَّرَهُ وَشَقَّ سَمْعَهُ وَبَصَرَهُ تَبَارَكَ اللهُ أَحْسنُ الْخَالِقينَ
Hadith-121.Transliteration: Allaahumma laka sajadtu wa bika 'aamantu, wa laka 'aslamtu, sajada wajhiya lillathee khalaqahu, wa sawwarahu, wa shaqqa sam'ahu wa basarahu, tabaarakallaahu 'ahsanul-khaliqeen.
Hadith-121.Translation: O, Allah, to You I prostrate myself and in You I believe. To You I have submitted. My face is prostrated to the One Who created it, and gave it hearing and sight. Blessed is Allah, the Best of creators.

Hadith-121.Title: While prostrating (sujood)
Hadith-121.Text: سُبْحَانَ ذِي الْجَبَرُوتِ وَالْمَلَكُوتِ وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ وَالْعَظَمَةِ
Hadith-121.Translation: Glory is to You, Master of power, of dominion, of majesty and greatness.

Hadith-121.Title: While prostrating (sujood)
Hadith-121.Text: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي ذَنْبِي كُلَّهُ: دِقَّهُ وَجِلَّهُ وَأَوَّ لَهُ وَآخِرَهُ وَعَلاَنِيَّتَهُ وَسِرَّهُ
Hadith-121.Transliteration: Allahum-maghfir lee thanbee kullahu, diqqahu wa jillahu, wa 'awwalahu wa 'aakhirahu wa 'alaaniyatahu wa sirrahu.
Hadith-121.Translation: O Allah, forgive me all my sins, great and small, the first and the last,  those that are apparent and those that are hidden.

Hadith-121.Title: While prostrating (sujood)
Hadith-121.Text: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِرِضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ وَبِمُعَافَاتِكَ مِنْ عُقُوبَتِكَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْكَ لاَ أُحْصِي ثَنَاءً عَلَيْكَ أَنْتَ كَاَم أَثْنَيْتَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ
Hadith-121.Transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oothu biridhaaka min sakhatika, wa bimu'aafaatika min 'uqoobatika wa 'a'oothu bika minka, laa 'uhsee thanaa'an'alayka 'Anta kamaa 'athnayta 'alaa nafsika.
Hadith-121.Translation: O Allah, I seek Your protection in Your pleasure from Your anger, and I seek protection in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek protection in You from You.I cannot count Your praises. You are as You have praised Yourself.

Hadith-252.Title: While returning from travel
Hadith-252.Text: أَللهُ أَكْبَرُ أَللهُ أَكْبَرُ أَللهُ أَكْبَرُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ آيِبُونَ ئَاتِبُونَ عَابِدُونَ سَاجِدُونَ لِرَبِّنا حَامِدُونَ صَدَقَ اللهُ وَعْدَهُ وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُ
Hadith-252.Transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku, wa lahul-hamdu, wa Huwa 'alaa kutti shay 'in Qadeer, 'aa'iboona, taa'iboona, 'aabidoona, lirabbinaa haamidoona, sadaqallaahu wa'dahu, wa nasara 'abdahu, wa hazamal-'ahzaaba wahdahu.
Hadith-252.Translation: Allah is the Most Great - three times. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. We return repentant to our Lord, worshipping our Lord, and praising our Lord. He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated the Confederates.

Surah-10.Title: Yunus 10:85
Surah-10.Text: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجۡعَلۡنَا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
Surah-10.Transliteration: rabbana la taj'alna fit'natan lil'qawmi al-zalimina
Surah-10.Translation: Our Lord! (Do) not make us a trial for the people the wrongdoers

Surah-10.Title: Yunus 10:86
Surah-10.Translation: And save us by Your Mercy from the people the disbelievers
